items.title: Cristina Zavalloni & Louis Andriessen
items.content: Dutchman Louis Andreissen and Italian vocalist Cristina Zavalloni have developed a close working relationship which began in 1998 with Passeggiata in tram in America e ritorno, and includes the 2010 monodrama, Anaïs Nin.

items.title: John Tomlinson & Harrison Birtwistle
items.content: Fellow Lancastrians Harrison Birtwistle and bass John Tomlinson talk about three-decades of creative collaboration, including the operatic roles Birtwistle, alongside librettist David Harsent, created especially for Tomlinson. The first was in 1991: the Green Knight and Bertilak in 'Gawain' and the second, the title role in 'The Minotaur' from 2007. But their collaboration goes back further still – to the recording of Birtwistle’s first opera in 1979.
items.contentSnippet: Fellow Lancastrians Harrison Birtwistle and bass John Tomlinson talk about three-decades of creative collaboration, including the operatic roles Birtwistle, alongside librettist David Harsent, created especially for Tomlinson. items.title: Wu Wei & Unsuk Chin
items.content: Originally from China, the sheng is a traditional instrument – a mouth organ – with a three-thousand year history. Its sound was part of Korean composer Unsuk Chin’s childhood and she had long dreamed of writing for it. She was inspired finally to fulfil her dream when she heard the playing of sheng virtuoso Wu Wei. With the help of Wu, Chin began the long, collaborative process of learning how to write for sheng which resulted in the remarkable Šu for sheng and orchestra – and a deep friendship between composer and performer.

items.title: Shara Worden & David Lang
items.content: David Lang and vocalist Shara Worden talk about their collaboration on his 2012 'death speaks', Lang’s 21st century take on Schubert song inspired by Shara Worden’s singing, at once rooted in classical and indie pop music.

items.title: Kari Kriikku & Magnus Lindberg
items.content: Fellow Finns Magnus Lindberg and clarinettist Kari Kriikku began a long and fruitful collaboration when they met as students. By far the most famous of the many pieces they’ve worked on together is Lindberg’s Clarinet Concerto which has met with extraordinary popular acclaim since its 2002 premiere.

items.title: Peter Erskine & Mark-Anthony Turnage
items.content: Mark-Anthony Turnage and jazz drummer Peter Erskine talk about a collaboration whose seeds were sown when an admiring teenage composer heard Erskine on Weather Report records in the late 1970s. Finally meeting in the 90s, they talk about their first major collaboration, â€˜Blood on the Floorâ€™ and the close musical, professional and personal friendship which grew from it.

title: Modern Muses
description: Creative collaborations in new music. A series where the world’s leading composers and performers explain how they cooperate in the creation of new work.
